titleStmt.title: Artur Trebitsch
born Vienna, April 17, 1880; died Eggersdorf, Sept 26, 1927

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Son of a Jewish silk manufacturer; Austrian writer, philosopher, and anti-semite, early promoter of the Nazi party, who belonged to the circle of Otto Weininger and Houston Stewart Chamberlain. He founded a publishing house, Antaios, in 1909 for his own publications (its name taken from one of the giants of Greek mythology).
